textBeforeTable: Tornado picks-up a pickup and spins it like a top. Not Tetris 2. Game here. 15 Dots Enough. Media: Daft Space. Special Delivery For Aperture Labs. This Might Be The World’s Most Dangerous Webcam. Hello? Images: Loony Box. Thanks Daniel. Expanded It. Match and Remove. Play: Thanks Ant and Mike Martinez and Acleacius. Links: Laurie. Bill Kunkel, Original Gaming Journalist, Dies at 61. textAfterTable: 3. Re: Dangerous web cam Sep 6, 2011, 14:32 kanniballl   banddirector wrote on Sep 6, 2011, 13:45: That's awesome! I can't help but wonder if any similarities are coincidental, or if a hardware designer was having a little fun ... Hard to say. My guess is an engineer might've snuck some aspects in and hoped nobody from legal/patents/copyright/etc noticed. I've seen all of those design pieces on web cams. The tri-pod legging to let it stand on its own or on top of a monitor. The shape of the thing itself isn't exactly that odd... you normally see more round but there's nothing odd there. And the lense probably only looks red/purple from certain angles, as I've seen on other lenses. Or perhaps it's just a dirty/oily lense. I doubt the company or even any managers knew or recognized it though, as the potential for Valve freaking out might
